DataElement.preferredName: Observation Study Protocol Version Study Post Biospecimen Retention Flag ISO21090.BL.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Specifies whether a biological specimen is retained beyond the duration of the study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Observation Study Protocol Version Study Post Biospecimen Retention Flag
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The condition of remaining in a place or position or of holding within.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Concepts.definition: Watching something and taking note of what happens.

The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

Property.preferredDefinition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.:The condition of remaining in a place or position or of holding within.:An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

Concepts.definition: A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The condition of remaining in a place or position or of holding within.
An indicator that can be set or unset in order to signal whether a particular condition is true.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader
Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 2/19/13 Added AIM Foundation Model CSI reference. jc
